SENT.plain: To elucidate the nature of an overabundance of collagen seen on microscopic examination in tuberous sclerous (TS), the hydroxyproline content in tissues and urine was determined
TS tissues of 5 patients were obtained on necropsy or plastic surgery
Urine was collected from 10 patients with TS and 19 controls
Tumors in kidney, pancreas, lung and heart but not brain contained more hydroxyproline than the surrounding tissues
In brain with the lowest hydroxyproline content, the tumor showed reduced hydroxyproline compared to normal
Collagen sheet in TS skin and shagreen patch showed the same hydroxyproline content as control skin

Th urinary hydroxyproline: creatinine ratios of the patients with TS were all higher than those in age-matched controls with or without anticonvulsant treatment except for congenital muscular dystrophy
The higher content of hydroxyproline in several affected tissues and urine of patients with TS might indicate that an increase in collagen synthesis occurs in TS
